016package com.exoreaction.xorcery.neo4j.client;
017
018import com.exoreaction.xorcery.lang.Enums;
019
020import java.util.ArrayList;
021import java.util.HashMap;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.Map;
024import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026
027public class WhereClauseBuilder {
028
029    public static WhereClauses where() {
030        return new WhereClauses();
031    }
032
033    public static void appendWhereClauses(StringBuilder query, List<String> whereClauses) {
034        if (!whereClauses.isEmpty()) {
035            query.append(" WHERE ");
036            for (int i = 0; i < whereClauses.size(); i++) {
037                String whereClause = whereClauses.get(i);
038                if (i > 0) {
039                    query.append(" AND ");
040                }
041
042                query.append(whereClause);
043            }
044        }
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * This builder creates a function that makes it easier to add WHERE clauses to Cypher queries.
049     * Specify the parameter type, the expected value type, and what WHERE clause that should be added if such a
050     * parameter is encountered
051     */
052    public static class WhereClauses
053            implements BiConsumer<GraphQuery, StringBuilder> {
054        Map<Enum<?>, Function<Object, String>> whereClauses = new HashMap<>();
055
056        private WhereClauses() {
057        }
058
059        public WhereClauses parameter(Enum<?> parameter, Class<?> valueType, String whereClause) {
060            Function<Object, String> current = whereClauses.computeIfAbsent(parameter, p -> value ->
061            {
062                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
063                        "WHERE clause parameter for " + Enums.toField(parameter) + " is of unknown type " + value + "(" +
064                                value.getClass().getName() + ")");
065            });
066
067            Function<Object, String> converter = value ->
068            {
069                if (valueType.isInstance(value)) {
070                    return whereClause;
071                } else {
072                    return current.apply(value);
073                }
074            };
075
076            whereClauses.put(parameter, converter);
077
078            return this;
079        }
080
081        @Override
082        public void accept(GraphQuery query, StringBuilder string) {
083
084            Map<Enum<?>, Object> parameters = query.getParameters();
085
086            if (!parameters.isEmpty()) {
087                // Add query parameters
088                List<String> clauses = new ArrayList<String>();
089                for (Map.Entry<Enum<?>, Object> entry : parameters.entrySet()) {
090                    if (entry.getValue() != null) {
091                        Function<Object, String> converter = whereClauses.get(entry.getKey());
092                        if (converter != null) {
093                            String whereClause = converter.apply(entry.getValue());
094                            if (whereClause != null) {
095                                clauses.add(whereClause);
096                            }
097                        }
098                    }
099                }
100
101                if (!clauses.isEmpty()) {
102                    appendWhereClauses(string, clauses);
103                }
104            }
105        }
106    }
107}
